radiographic_examinations.findings: Trace amount of bilateral pleural effusion, more on the left. Opacification in the left lung base may represent consolidation, possibly from aspiration. The liver is normal in size and morphology with mild steatosis. The gallbladder contains stones without wall thickening or abnormal enhancement. The intra and extrahepatic biliary ducts are normal. The pancreas is swollen with peripancreatic edema. The main pancreatic duct is not visualized. The kidneys, adrenals, and spleen (1 cm accessory) are normal. Small amount of free fluid in the abdomen, no concerning lymphadenopathy.
